Diagnosis
	1. Extensive stage small cell lung cancer with liver, bone, and adrenal metastases

	Date of diagnosis
	April 2024

	Treatment aim
	Palliative

	Summary of completed treatment and relevant dates

	Surgery
	12 Apr 2024 Liver biopsy

	Radiotherapy
	Not yet commenced

	Chemotherapy
	Not yet commenced

	Clinical studies
	Not eligible

	Current disease status
	Newly diagnosed extensive stage disease

	Current issues
	Severe fatigue, dyspnoea, right upper quadrant pain, weight loss

	Summary of consultation
	This 64 year old gentleman presented following a 6-week history of progressive breathlessnes, right upper quadrant pain, and significant weight loss of 12kg. Initial CT thorax/abdomen/pelvis on 5/4/24 demonstrated a 7.2cm right hilar mass with mediastinal lymphadenopathy, multiple liver metastases (largest 6.5cm), bilateral adrenal masses, and widespread bone metastases including thoracic spine. Liver biopsy on 12/4/24 confirmed small cell carcinoma, with positive staining for Synaptophysin and CD56.

He has significant comorbidities including poorly controlled type 2 diabetes (latest HbA1c 86), chronic kidney disease stage 3b (eGFR 32), and previous myocardial infarction in 2020 with residual left ventricular dysfunction (EF 42%). His performance status has deteriorated from 1 to 3 over the past month, now spending approximately 70% of the day in bed or chair.

On examination today, he appears cachectic with marked muscle wasting. Oxygen saturations 92% on room air. There is dullness to percussion and reduced breath sounds in the right lung base. The liver edge is palpable 4cm below the costal margin and tender. No focal neurological deficits.

I have discussed his diagnosis and poor prognosis at length with him and his wife today. Given his extensive disease, poor performance status, and significant comorbidities, standard platinum-etoposide chemotherapy carries substantial risks. However, without treatment his prognosis is likely to be measured in weeks.

	Further investigations
	Urgent MRI brain to exclude CNS metastases
	Cardiac MUGA scan to reassess left ventricular function

	Medication prescribed
	Dexamethasone 4mg bd
	Oxycodone MR 10mg bd
	Metoclopramide 10mg tds prn

	Follow up
	Urgent review in lung oncology clinic next week with investigation results

	Required GP actions
	Please monitor blood glucose given steroid commencement
	Please refer to district nurses for support

	Summary of information given to patient
	Diagnosis of extensive stage small cell lung cancer explained
	Poor prognosis discussed
	Risks and benefits of palliative chemotherapy outlined
